intro: Ornithogalum etruscum, commonly known as the Etruscan star-of-Bethlehem, is a bulbous plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring and is often found in rocky or dry habitats. It is adapted to Mediterranean climates and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. However, it can be invasive in certain regions if not managed properly.
